# sailpoint_entitlement (Data Source)

Use this data source to retrieve detailed information about a specific SailPoint Entitlement. Entitlements represent permissions or access rights from source systems (e.g., AD groups, application roles). See [Entitlement Documentation](https://developer.sailpoint.com/docs/api/v2025/get-entitlement) for more information.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Example: Read an existing entitlement by ID
data "sailpoint_entitlement" "ad_group" {
  id = "2c91808874ff91550175097daaec161c"
}

# Use the entitlement data
output "entitlement_name" {
  value = data.sailpoint_entitlement.ad_group.name
}

output "entitlement_description" {
  value = data.sailpoint_entitlement.ad_group.description
}

output "entitlement_value" {
  value = data.sailpoint_entitlement.ad_group.value
}

output "entitlement_privileged" {
  value = data.sailpoint_entitlement.ad_group.privileged
}

output "entitlement_requestable" {
  value = data.sailpoint_entitlement.ad_group.requestable
}

output "entitlement_source" {
  value = data.sailpoint_entitlement.ad_group.source
}

output "entitlement_owner" {
  value = data.sailpoint_entitlement.ad_group.owner
}

# Example: Check if an entitlement is privileged and requestable
data "sailpoint_entitlement" "sensitive_group" {
  id = "2c91808a7b5c3e1d017b5c4a8f6d0003"
}

output "is_high_risk_access" {
  value       = data.sailpoint_entitlement.sensitive_group.privileged && data.sailpoint_entitlement.sensitive_group.requestable
  description = "True if this is a privileged entitlement that users can request"
}

# Example: Display entitlement metadata
data "sailpoint_entitlement" "app_role" {
  id = "2c91808568c529c60168cca6f90c1316"
}

output "entitlement_metadata" {
  value = {
    name                      = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.name
    attribute                 = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.attribute
    value                     = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.value
    source_schema_object_type = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.source_schema_object_type
    source_name               = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.source.name
    cloud_governed            = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.cloud_governed
    created                   = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.created
    modified                  = data.sailpoint_entitlement.app_role.modified
  }
}

# Example: Access entitlement with access model metadata
data "sailpoint_entitlement" "classified_entitlement" {
  id = "2c91808a7c8a4b2d017c8b6e4f1a0042"
}

output "access_metadata_attributes" {
  value       = data.sailpoint_entitlement.classified_entitlement.access_model_metadata.attributes
  description = "Access model metadata classification attributes"
}

# Example: Check if entitlement has specific metadata values
output "has_governance_metadata" {
  value       = length([for attr in data.sailpoint_entitlement.classified_entitlement.access_model_metadata.attributes : attr if attr.type == "governance"]) > 0
  description = "True if this entitlement has governance-type metadata"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `id` (String) Unique identifier (UUID) of the entitlement.

### Read-Only

- `access_model_metadata` (Attributes) Object containing additional data to classify the entitlement. Contains an `attributes` array with metadata items including key, name, type, description, and values. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--access_model_metadata))
- `attribute` (String) The account schema attribute this entitlement represents (e.g., 'memberOf').
- `attributes` (String) Custom field name-value pairs as a JSON string.
- `cloud_governed` (Boolean) Boolean flag indicating if the entitlement is cloud-governed.
- `created` (String) ISO-8601 timestamp when the entitlement was created (computed).
- `description` (String) Description of the entitlement's purpose and scope.
- `direct_permissions` (Attributes List) Array of direct permission objects with `rights` (array of permission rights) and `target` (target resource). (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--direct_permissions))
- `manually_updated_fields` (Attributes) Object tracking which fields have been manually updated. Contains `display_name` and `description` boolean flags. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--manually_updated_fields))
- `modified` (String) ISO-8601 timestamp when the entitlement was last modified (computed).
- `name` (String) Display name of the entitlement.
- `owner` (Attributes) Owner of the entitlement. Contains `type` (e.g., 'IDENTITY'), `id` (UUID), and `name`. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--owner))
- `privileged` (Boolean) Boolean flag indicating if the entitlement is marked as privileged.
- `requestable` (Boolean) Boolean flag indicating if the entitlement can be requested by users through access requests.
- `segments` (List of String) Array of segment IDs that this entitlement belongs to.
- `source` (Attributes) The source system this entitlement comes from. Contains `type` (e.g., 'SOURCE'), `id` (UUID), and `name`. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--source))
- `source_schema_object_type` (String) The type of object in the source schema (e.g., 'group').
- `value` (String) The actual value of the entitlement attribute.

<a id="nestedatt--access_model_metadata"></a>
### Nested Schema for `access_model_metadata`

Read-Only:

- `attributes` (Attributes List) Array of metadata attributes to classify the entitlement. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--access_model_metadata--attributes))

<a id="nestedatt--access_model_metadata--attributes"></a>
### Nested Schema for `access_model_metadata.attributes`

Read-Only:

- `description` (String) Describes the metadata item.
- `key` (String) Unique identifier for the metadata type (e.g., 'iscCsp').
- `multiselect` (Boolean) Allows selecting multiple values (default: false).
- `name` (String) Human readable name of the metadata type (e.g., 'CSP').
- `object_types` (List of String) The types of objects (e.g., ['general']).
- `status` (String) The state of the metadata item (e.g., 'active').
- `type` (String) The type of the metadata item (e.g., 'governance').
- `values` (Attributes List) The values to assign to the metadata item. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--access_model_metadata--attributes--values))

<a id="nestedatt--access_model_metadata--attributes--values"></a>
### Nested Schema for `access_model_metadata.attributes.values`

Read-Only:

- `name` (String) Display name of the value (e.g., 'Development').
- `status` (String) The status of the individual value (e.g., 'active').
- `value` (String) The value to assign to the metadata item (e.g., 'development').




<a id="nestedatt--direct_permissions"></a>
### Nested Schema for `direct_permissions`

Read-Only:

- `rights` (List of String) Array of permission rights (e.g., SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE).
- `target` (String) Target resource for the permission.


<a id="nestedatt--manually_updated_fields"></a>
### Nested Schema for `manually_updated_fields`

Read-Only:

- `description` (Boolean) Indicates if the description was manually updated.
- `display_name` (Boolean) Indicates if the display name was manually updated.


<a id="nestedatt--owner"></a>
### Nested Schema for `owner`

Read-Only:

- `id` (String) The unique identifier (UUID) of the owner.
- `name` (String) The name of the owner.
- `type` (String) The type of the owner (e.g., IDENTITY).


<a id="nestedatt--source"></a>
### Nested Schema for `source`

Read-Only:

- `id` (String) The unique identifier (UUID) of the source.
- `name` (String) The name of the source.
- `type` (String) The type of the source (e.g., SOURCE).
